title: Recommendations for a typophobe
content: I’ve only just started studying graphic design and this immense world of typography seems quite imposing and impenetrable. Does anybody have any recommendations for inspiring books/designers/artwork etc that can help convert me into a true typophile?
author: blw

comments.content:
\>\>imposing and impenetrable  
hmm...funny

Books that can help you convert into a true typophile  
 [Typophile books](http://web.archive.org/web/20091008034650/http:/www.typophile.com/books)

António
Hi Antonio, thanks for the link. Could you recommend a particular book just to get me started? Cheers.
The Elements of Typographic Style by Robert Bringhurst
Along with Matt’s suggestion: The Complete Manual of Typography by James Felici.

The Elements of Typographic Style by Robert Bringhurst

António Fonseca

Should you be able to find this book you will be pleased:

“Typography: an Encyclopedic Survey of Type Design and Techniques Throughout History by Friedrich Fiedl, Nicolaus Ott, and Bernard Stein. ISBN: 1-57912-023-7.
Thanks for your suggestions - I’m heading off to the library right now...
